intro: Cyathocline lyrata, commonly known as the lyrated cyathocline, is a rare and striking member of the Cyathocline genus. It is characterized by its distinctive, lyre-shaped leaves that are often variegated with shades of green and white. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
